Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology - with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. We Are Bosch. At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch teams around the world. Their creativity is the key to innovation through connected living, mobility, or industry. Let’s grow together, enjoy more, and inspire each other. Work #LikeABoschReinvent yourself: At Bosch, you will evolve.Discover new directions: At Bosch, you will find your place.Balance your life: At Bosch, your job matches your lifestyle.Celebrate success: At Bosch, we celebrate you.Be yourself: At Bosch, we value values.Shape tomorrow: At Bosch, you change lives.The Cross Domain Computing Solutions (XC) division develops state of the art solutions as well as advanced features leading to the future of automotive electronics and Assisted and Automated Driving. Our dynamic team focuses on innovating and developing user-centric solutions for in-vehicle connected information systems, Advanced Network Solutions, and Drivers Assistance features and systems enabling Autonomous Driving.Do you want to contribute ideas that will shape the future of mobility? As one of the world’s largest automotive suppliers, Bosch is driving change in the mobility sector. Join us and you can help innovate, create, and form the future of mobility.Job DescriptionAs the Engineering Technician Intern, you can expect to learn alongside a group of tenured professional with the following responsibilities:Support Engineering technicians with their daily work:Assist with builds: test boxes, special cables, fixtures etc.Assist with vehicle work: drop/install fascia, install sensors etc.Assist during re-flash activitiesOrganize lab areasSupport application teams:Run Diagnostic reports on test vehiclesTransport test vehicles between customer and BoschAssist in collecting data and performing vehicle test casesTarget car driver for Predictive Emergency Braking tests etc.Update test vehicles with new Bosch and Partner ECU SoftwareQualificationsRequired Qualifications:Enrolled in a 2 Year degree College pursing an Associate's degree (e.g. Mechatronics, Robotics, Electrical, Applied Science, Automotive) Some mechanical and electrical vehicle understanding and practical application experience.Driver's license and good driving recordBasic MS office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)Good communicator that works effectively with application engineers and senior techniciansMinimum 3.0 GPAMust be able to work >24hrs per week Additional InformationIndefinite U.S. work authorized individuals only. Future sponsorship for work authorization unavailable. Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability / veterans *Bosch adheres to Federal, State, and Local laws regarding drug-testing. Employment is contingent upon the successful completion of a drug screen and background check. Candidates who have been offered the position must pass both screenings before their start date.
